div.p: ASHBY ST. LEDGERS. Will of William Bacheler of Assheby-leger, chaplain, made the Wednesday next after the feast of St. Hilary, bp., 1348. MS. Ch. Northants. 1.

BUCKBY (Long). Particulars of a parcel of lands and possessions of the manor of Long Buckebye, belonging to the Queen, antiently part of the duchy of Lancaster, formerly in the tenure of Roger Carrell or his assigns by lease from the duchy, of which lease 8 years were unexpired in 1602. MS. Ch. Northants. 2.

COATON. Adam, the abbot, and convent of St. James without Northampton, grant to Henry, son of Robert de Northampton, for his homage and service, a certain tenement in Cotene without Northampton, which Matilda Leman formerly held of them; also they grant all the tenements which they have in Cotene; paying annually to them and their successors 11s. of silver. Witness: sir Simon de Torp, sheriff of Northampton, etc. (c. 1248-50.) MS. Ch. Northants. 8.

Indenture, between Robert, son of sir Edward Doyle, kt., on the one part, and William Driffeld of Northampton, deyster, Agnes his wife, and John, Thomas, and Agnes, their children, of the other part, witnessing that the said Robert has granted to the said parties the whole of the close and dovecot opposite the house of St. Leonard in Coton near Northampton, and also a piece of meadow in the meadows of Hardyngesthorn, to hold the same for their lives, and 10 years following the decease of the longest liver of them, at an annual rent of 15s. and the usual suit and service. Dated at Coton, 1 October, 7 Hen. V. MS. Ch. Northants. 4.

CRICK. Robert de Cursun grants to Alan de Swyneford, for his homage and service, half a virgate of land with appurtenances in Crec, except toft and croft, namely that which Walter Beel held. To hold to him and his heirs for an annual payment of one halfpenny at Easter for all secular service, custom, and demand. (c. 1220-40.) MS. Ch. Northants. 5.

Adam le Veneter grants to Alan de Swineford his whole right in one half virgate of land in the village of Crec, namely that which Walter le Bel sometime held; to hold to the said Alan and his heirs as in the charter of sir Robert de Curson, lord of the fee. (c. 1230.) MS. Ch. Northants. 6.

GUILSBOROUGH. Letters patent of Queen Elizabeth, dated at Westminster, June 20th, and 41st year of her reign, granting a licence of alienation to Richard, William, and Henry Gardner, for two virgates of land in Gilsborowe, late parcel of the possessions of William Belcher, esq., and held of the crown in capite. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Northants. 14.

Letters patent of K. James I, dated at Westminster, 1 Sept., 10 of his reign, granting a licence of alienation to Dabridgcourt Belcher,
esq., Elizabeth his wife, and Christiana Belcher, widow, for a messuage, garden, &c., in Guilsborrowe, to Richard and William Gardner. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Northants. 15

HARDINGSTONE and COTES. Roger, son of master Roger de Boudon, the 26 of March, 17 Ed. II, grants and assigns in dower, for himself and heirs, to Isabella, his mother, formerly wife of the said master Roger, a certain house and the third part of a grange, dovecot, 6s. annual rent, together with certain parcels of land in Hardingstorn and Cotes. Dated at Cotes in the parish of Hardingstorn the day and year above written. MS. Ch. Northants. 3.

NORTHAMPTON. Mandate from Pope Innocent the 3rd to the archbishop of Canterbury and the bishops of London and Ely, to prohibit the parochial clergy of Northampton founding chapels for divine offices, whereof complaint had been made by the prior and monks of St. Andrew, Northampton, to whom all the churches of Northampton belonged. Dated at Lateran, 8 Id. April, 4th pontificial year (i. e. 1201.) MS. Ch. Northants. 7.

Nicholas, son of Seman de Stoke, of the county of Northampton, is bound to John, son of Robert Loveday, in 10 marks sterling, payable at the feast of St. Martin the bp., in the winter, 23 Ed. [I]. Dated at London, the Monday on the feast of St. Mark the evangelist, the year above written. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Northants. 11.

PETERBOROUGH (Abbey of). Indenture witnessing that William, the abbot, and convent of Peterborough, demise to George Sheffeld and Richard Sheffeld his son, their manor of Scottor, also their mill of Benton, &c. To hold the same for 50 years after the death of John Atclyff the present holder, paying annually 6 sterling. Dated Michaelmas, 1 Richard III. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Northants. 12 .

Indenture made 3 May, 29 Hen. VIII, by which John, the abbot, and convent of Peterborough demise to sir William Tyrwhit the scite of their manor of Scottor., co. Lincoln, &c., for 80 years, paying annually for the same Â£8 6s. 8d. [With seal.] MS. Ch. Northants. 13.

STOKE. Sir John Daundelyn, kt., grants a release to Robert de Wodeneuton in Stoke, upon consideration of the payment of 22s., of his claim to three roods of arable land in the fields of Stoke in which he had been infeoffed by the said Robert. Dated at Stoke the Wednesday next after the feast of St. James the apostle, 16 Ed. II. MS. Ch. Northants. 10.
BOUGHTON. Plan of the house and gardens of Boughton, taken in the year 1712 by Delahaye. MS. Map Northants a. 1

NORTHAMPTON (Priory of St. Andrew's at). The account of Dr. Richard Layton and Robert Sowthwell, esq., commissioners for
the dissolution of the priory of St. Andrew, Northampton and the viewing, and selling of all the plate, ornaments, implements, stock and store, bells and lead, with an account of payments made on account of the same, declared to sir Edward North, kt., chancellor of the court of augmentations. Signed by Edward North, Walter Hendle, and ... Bacon. Dated 24 November, 36 Hen. VIII. Rolls, 2.

PETERBOROUGH. A survey of the several inclosures lying in Peterborough fenn, the great cemonon, etc. surveyed for the use of the rt. hon. lord Torrington by Robert Wright, surveyor in Castor, near Peterborough, anno 1714. Rolls, 3.

Emma Griffyn, late wife of John Griffyn, esq., has received of William Lane, the prior, and convent of Daventre 21s. 8d. for a certain pasture lying in the fields of Bucby. Dated 8 January, 6 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 146.
N. the prior, and the convent of Daventry, grant to ... a messuage ... [A fragment, much rubbed.] (Nicholas, prior, 1231-1264.) MS. Ch. Northants. 11.
Charter by which ..., with the assent of Beatrice his wife, grants to the prior and convent of Daventry ... in frankalmoigne ... [Partly obliterated.] (c. 1260-70.) MS. Ch. Northants. 18.
Fragment of the rule of the priory, containing regulations respecting novices. On the back a fragment of a bede-roll in French, with notes of prayers. (c. 1300.) MS. Ch. Northants. 22b.
Fragment of an inhibition of ... , bp. of Lincoln, ... Dated 13 Kl. July, [1310?]. MS. Ch. Northants. 29b.
Illegible charter, temp. Ed. I. MS. Ch. Northants. 30a.
Small fragment of a charter, temp. Ed. II. MS. Ch. Northants. 41a.
Mutilated charter by which William Prische of Daventry grants to Michael de Northampton certain arable land in Daventry. Dated 10 Ed. II. MS. Ch. Northants. 44.

Symon de Crek of Daventr' and Sarah his wife grant to sir William Snow (?), chaplain, four ridges ("seliones") of land in the Eastfield of Daventr'. Dated at Daventr' on the feast of St. Lucy the virgin and martyr, 18 Ed. II. MS. Ch. Northants. 56.

William ... de Olthorpe quit-claims to Edmund Newenham of Stuttesbyry and William ... all right in ... of the prior and convent of Daventry ... in the village and fields of Daventry. [Mutilated.] Dated ..., 20 Ed. III. MS. Ch. Northants. 63c.
Charter (indented) almost entirely illegible. Dated at Daventry on the feast of St. Michael, 22 Ed. III. (Date too illegible to be certain.) MS. Ch. Northants. 68.
Tettered fragment of a deposition in some suit concerning tithes. [temp. Ric. II?]. MS. Ch. Northants. 74.
Receipt dated 1384 [?]. [Nearly obliterated.] MS. Ch. Northants. 77.

Richard ... and Elizabeth his wife grant to William Fuwer of Daventre, Alice his wife, and John their son, a house and garden in Daventre, for the term of their lives, at an annual rent of 12d. in silver. Dated at Daventre feast of St. Ambrose, 13 Ric. II. MS. Ch. Northants. 80.

Citation by the court of Canterbury to the priory of Catesby in a tithe cause by the prior and convent of Daventry by the prioress and convent of Catesby. Dated at London the Nones of October, 1410. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Northants. 92.

Hugh Cleydon of Daventry grants to Thomas Hendes of Norton, William Haddon, ... all right in two acres of arable land ... Dated ... feast of Epiphany, ... 6 or 7 Henry V. [A fragment.] MS. Ch. Northants. 97.
Terra Ricardi Hall; particulars of 60 acres, of which it appears from an endowment that the rents belonged to the almonry of the priory. Temp. Hen. VI, [On paper.] MS. Ch. Northants. 102a.

William Smith of Daventry, glover, and Agnes his wife, remit and quit-claim to Simon S...pe alias Staverton all right of action, by reason of any debt, account, &c., to the date of these presents. Dated ... 1 Ric. III. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Northants. 122.
Fragment of a charter from Elizabeth and Simon ..., 1 (Rich. III). MS. Ch. Northants. 125.
Fragment of a receipt given by Thomas Murd ... to the prior of Daventry. Dated ... May, .. Hen. VII. (probably for West Haddon) MS. Ch. Northants. 137.
Outgoings of courts held in Nov., Feb., and March, the 5th year of Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 143.

Indenture made between Thomas Eston, the prior, and convent of Daventr' of the one part, and William Huse of London, gentleman, of the other, witnesseth, that whereas the prior and convent the 13 day of February, 12 Hen. VII, granted to the same William an annual rent of Â£5 for 4 years, it is now agreed that upon payment of Â£17 18s. in three years the said annual rent shall be declared void. Dated .. February, 12 Hen. VII. [Mutilated.] [English] MS. Ch. Northants. 153.
An acknowledgment that John Wygmore and Nicholas Traford have received [of the prior of Daventry (?)] 10 marks,of annual pension. (Hen. VII.). [A fragment.] MS. Ch. Northants. 154.

Thomas Ilston, the prior, and convent of Daventre, are bound to John Brugge, citizen and draper of London, in a sum of Â£69 sterling,
to be paid to him or his attorney on the 2nd day of December next after the date of these presents. Dated in their chapter house, 3 Dec., 1503, and 19 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 166.

Thomas Ilston, the prior, and convent of Daventry hold themselves bound to Thomas Ward, citizen and mercer of London, in a sum of ... Dated at Daventry, 22 Hen. VII. [Fragment.] MS. Ch. Northants. 171.
An acknowledgment that Thomas Lute of London, gentleman, has received of William, prior of Daventry, 100s. for rent due 21 and 22 [Hen. VII]. Dated 9 August, 22 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 170a.

Fine made at Westminster on the octave of St. Martin, 4 Henry VI, between Thomas Nassyngton, clerk, Thomas Everdon, ... Snottescombe, and John Irmongere of Daventre, plaintiffs, and John Perkyn and Matilda his wife, deforciants, concerning two messuages and 4 1/2 acres of land in Daventre and Drayton, namely that the said John and Matilda quitclaim all their right in consideration of the receipt of 20 marks. MS. Ch. Northants. 98.

DAVENTRY, HADDON, and WELTON. Fragment of a list of names in Daventry, Haddon, to which the seals of the dean of Daventry, parson of Braybroke. (Heading gone.) Temp. Hen. III. (c. 1260-70.) MS. Ch. Northants. 28.

An acknowledgment by John, bishop of Lincoln, of the receipt of 8s. of the prior of Daventry, by the name of an annual pension, ending Michaelmas last, for the appropriation of the churches of Daventry, Staverton, West Haddon, and Norton. Dated 6 October, after 1480 "anno domini millesimo ... et nostre transl[ationis] anno [sexto?]". [The bishop therefore was John Russell, translated from Rochester in Sept. 1480. John Chedworth, the bishop in 1452, had not been translated.] MS. Ch. Northants. 106.
Similar receipt [see Ch. 106] by Thomas, bp. of Lincoln, dated 12 October, 1479. MS. Ch. Northants. 114.
Similar receipt [see Ch. 106] by William, bp. of Lincoln, dated 31 October, 1499. MS. Ch. Northants. 160 .
Similar receipt [see Ch. 106] by William, bp. of Lincoln, dated 4 October, 1506. MS. Ch. Northants. 167.
Similar receipt [see Ch. 106] by William, bp. of Lincoln, dated . . October, 1498. MS. Ch. Northants. 172.

An acknowledgment that Hadrian Castellensis, prothonotary for the pope in England, and collector-general, has received of the prior of Daventry 7s. for procurations. Dated 1 April, 1501. MS. Ch. Northants. 163.
Similar receipt [see Ch. 163], dated 26 March, 1505. MS. Ch. Northants. 169.
Similar receipt[see Ch. 163], dated 26 March, 1506. MS. Ch. Northants. 168.
An acknowledgment that Nicholas, Clerk of Worcester, cook, has received of the prior of Daventry 26s. 8d. in payment of an annual corrody. Dated 8 November, 1 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 128b.
Similar receipt [see Ch. 128b], dated 13 May, 2 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 129.
Similar receipt [see Ch. 128b], dated 1 June, 3 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 139.
Similar receipt [see Ch. 128b], dated 3 May, 4 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 141.
Fragment of a similar receipt [see Ch. 128b], Nov. ... Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 130.
Nicholas Griffyn, esq., of Braybroke, has received of the prior and convent of Daventre Â£4 6s. 8d. for a meadow called Sandford in the parish of ... Dated 13 ..., Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Northants. 101.
Similar receipt [see Ch. 101]for 43s. 4d., in fall payment of a year's rent of Â£4 6s. 8d. dated October, 16 Ed. IV. MS. Ch. Northants. 111.
Similar receipt [see Ch. 101]for 21s. 8d., dated 27 Jan., .. Hen. VII(?). [Almost entirely illegible.] MS. Ch. Northants. 112.
Emota Gryffyn, widow, has received of William Lane, the prior of Daventr', 21s. 8d. due at feast of St. John Bapt. last. Dated 1 July, 3 (?) Henry VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 124.
Fragment of a similar receipt [see Ch. 124] for Â£6 13s. 4d., 2 Hen. VII, for which she quarantees the prior of Daventry with regard to Thomas Entwyssyll. MS. Ch. Northants. 133.
Similar receipt [see Ch. 124] for Â£6 10s., for one year and a half, ending at Annunc. last, dated 20 May, 3 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 138.

An acknowledgment that Thomas Entwisyll, esq., of Nowesley, co. Leicester, has received of the prior and convent of Daventry 43s. 4d. for the term of Easter last. Dated at Nowesley, 30 April, 1 Ric. III. MS. Ch. Northants. 121.
Similar receipt [see Ch. 121], dated 10 May, 2 Ric. III, being a payment made to him by the prior on the precept of John Gryffone for a certain "feodo". MS. Ch. Northants. 123.

An acknowledgment that John Wykeley, abbot of St. James near Northampton, has received of the prior of Daventry 10s. in full payment [of the tithes of Sandford mede]. Dated 15 ... MS. Ch. Northants. 119.
Similar receipt [see Ch. 119]given by Thomas Barker, steward of the monastery of St. James, dated 3 Nov., 1 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 128a.
An acknowledgment that John, abbot of St. James near Northampton, has received of the prior of Daventry 40s. for the tithes of Sylesworth. Dated 13 March, 6 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 144.
Similar receipt [see Ch. 144], dated 20 Feb., 8 Hen. [VII]. MS. Ch. Northants. 151.
Similar receipt [see Ch. 144], dated ... 4 Hen. VII. [Partially illegible.] MS. Ch. Northants. 142.

An acknowledgment that John, abbot of St. James near Northampton, has received of the prior of Daventry 50s. for the. tithes of Sylles[orthe] and Sandford mede. Dated 4 October, .. Hen. VII. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Northants. 155.
Similar receipt [see Ch. 155]by John, abbot of St. James near Northampton, dated 10 March, 7 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 165.
Mutilated charter concerning West Haddon. Power of attorney from Margery, lately the wife of .... for giving seisin. Temp. Ed. III. MS. Ch. Northants. 59.

Mutilated charter ... Thurston of Rokeby, widow, appoints Thomas Wilee of West Haddon her attorney to give seisin to John Harecourte of lands, rents, &c., in .... Dated at West Haddon the Monday next after the feast Nativ. ... [Hen. VII.] [Fragment.] MS. Ch. Northants. 158.
Charter concerning lands at West Haddon. Temp. Hen. VII. [Illegible.] MS. Ch. Northants. 157,

An acknowledgment that John Shepey, sub-prior and pitancier of the cathedral church of St. Mary the Virgin of Coventry, has received 6s. from the prior and convent of Daventry for a certain annual rent for half a king fee in West Haddon. Dated at Coventry on the feast of St. George, 1485. MS. Ch. Northants. 127.
Similar receipt [see Ch. 127] given by Richard Drowth, sub-prior and pitancier of the cathedral church of St. Mary the Virgin of Coventry, 4 October, 2 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 135.
Similar receipt [see Ch. 127] given by Robert Grene, pitancier of the cathedral church of St. Mary the Virgin of Coventry, on the feast of St. George, 1491. MS. Ch. Northants. 145.
Similar receipt [see Ch. 127] by Robert Grene, pitancier of the cathedral church of St. Mary the Virgin of Coventry, dated 1 October, 1499. MS. Ch. Northants. 162.
Similar receipt [see Ch. 127] given by John Brystowe, pitancier of the cathedral church of St. Mary the Virgin of Coventry, 22 Dec., .. Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 156.
John Chapeleyn of Norton near Daventre binds himself to William Smyth of Muscote in a sum of Â£100 to be paid at the feast of Easter next. Dated March? 17 Hen. VI. MS. Ch. Northants. 103.

PRESTON (Great). Bond entered into by Thomas Chapell of Great Preston, husbandman, with William, the prior, and convent of Daventry. Dated the 6th of Dec., 18 Ed. III. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Northants. 64.

John Falcok, of Preston near Wyngham, grants to Alexander Norman, wax-chandler of Sandwich, half an acre and half a rood of land in the parish of Preston. Dated at Preston, 19 March, 3 Hen. V. MS. Ch. Northants. 93.

PRESTON (Little). An acknowledgment given by William Weston, rector of the church of Mersh, co. Bucks, to the prior and convent of Daventre of the receipt of 33s. 4d. for an annual pension for the tithes of Little Preston. Dated 12 (?) Nov., 21 Ed. IV. MS. Ch. Northants. 117.
Similar receipt, dated 3 June, 1 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 131.
Similar receipt, dated 9 July, 2 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 132.
Similar receipt, dated May, .. Hen. VII. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Northants. 136.
Similar receipt, dated 7 Feb., .. Hen. VII. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Northants. 140.
Similar receipt, dated ... Hen VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 150.
Similar receipt, dated 23 July, 9 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 152.
Similar receipt, dated 17 May, 16 Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 164a.
Similar receipt, dated 12 Nov., .. Hen. VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 164b.

PRESTON CAPES. An acknowledgment that Richard Barlwyk alias , perpetual vicar of Preston Capes, co. Northampton, has received of William Lane, the prior, and convent of Daventry, 36s. Dated 1487. [A fragment.] MS. Ch. Northants. 134.
Similar receipt, dated morrow of Circumcision, 1485. MS. Ch. Northants. 126.
Similar receipt, dated 1488. MS. Ch. Northants. 148.
Similar receipt, dated .. Hen. VII. [Half obliterated.] MS. Ch. Northants. 149.
Mutilated deed relating to Staverton church. [Temp. Hen. IV.] MS. Ch. Northants. 85a.

Thomas Andrewode of Welton, gent., and Robert Gebynce of Staverton, remit and quit-claim to Thomas Chadburn and others, all right of action against them for debts, &c., to the date of this writing. Dated [30 June?] 13 Hen. VII. [Partly illegible.] MS. Ch. Northants. 159a.
LIMPENHOW. Robert, son of Edward Browne of Limpenhow, grants to William Norton and Mary his wife one piece of land in the field of Limpenhow. Dated 3 Feb., 1640. MS. Ch. Northants. 16.

STENE. Pardon under the sign manual of K. Henry VII. to Thomas Barker of Stenemor for the alleged taking of arms at Bosworth felde. Dated at the manor of Richemount, 27 November, 21 of his reign. MS. Ch. Northants. 17.
SWYNEFORD. Alice, formerly wife of Richard Gyffard of Gyldesborough, grants to John her son the whole of her lands &c. in Swyneford. (c. 1260-70.) MS. Ch. Northants. 18.

BROCKHOLLE. Bond in Â£25 given by Robert Skypton of Brockholle, yeoman, to Thomas Ilstori, prior of Daventr', payable on the feast of the nativity of our Lord following the date of these presents. Dated at Daventr', 16 May, 3 Hen. VIII. MS. Ch. Northants. 173.
Fragment of a charter dated 7 [Ed. II]?, being a release of some land at Daventry to the priory. [With oval white seal "S' Her' HILDBROC"] MS. Ch. Northants. 191.
Mutilated charter dated 1318. MS. Ch. Northants. 194.

Indenture made between William, the prior, and convent of Daventre, of the one part, and John Waundell of Daventre of the other part, being a confirmation of an annual rent of 3s. d4. payable during the life of Elizabeth, late wife of John Herberd of Throp, demised by her to the said John Waundell. Dated at Daventre on the feast of St. Laurence, 19 Ric. II. MS. Ch. Northants. 210.

Mutilated fragment of some notes of English history, mentioning the battles of Lewes and Evesham; that Roger and Philip of Worcester were in Ireland with H. John; etc. (Written c. 1300.) MS. Ch. Northants. 213.

John, son and heir of Edmund Warilawe of Daventre, grants to Richard Harvy, clerk, and William Longge of Staverton, two messuages with gardens and closes. Dated at Daventre, 26 April, .. [Hen. VI.] MS. Ch. Northants. 215.
Letters patent of K. Hen. VI, dated at Westminster, 26 June, 3rd of his reign, being a general pardon to the prior and convent of Daventry. [Much rubbed.] MS. Ch. Northants. 218.
An acquittance to the prior of Daventry by William Weston, rector of Mersh, co. Bucks, for 3s. 4d. Dated .. May, 16 Ed. IV. [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Northants. 220.

William Newenham, esq., justice of the peace for the county of Northamp., to the bailiffs to Daventry, releasing Henry Smyth and John Malyn of Daventry from arrest, as they have given bail to appear to keep the peace towards John Baxstere, etc. Dated 10 April, 16 Ed. IV. MS. Ch. Northants. 221.

George Monox and William Rycardes remit and quit-claim to Thomas Ylston, the prior of the monastery of Daventre, all right of action &c. to this present date. Dated 1 May, 21 Henry VII. MS. Ch. Northants. 225.

Thomas Ilstone, the prior, and convent of Daventre, are bound to John Warde, citizen and alderman of London, and Thomas Frowyk, sergeant-at-law, in Â£200 sterling, payable the 4th of April, 1499; dated 30 March 1498. MS. Ch. Northants. 226.

MUSCOTE. Indenture witnessing that, whereas John Chapeleyn of Norton, near Daventre, is bound to William Smyth of Muscote, husbandman, in Â£100, payable at the feast of Easter next; yet the said William grants by these presents that if he and his assigns hold peaceably those lands &c. in Mucote which the said John demised to him by charter, then the said bond to be void. Dated 6 [March?], 17 [Hen. VI.] [Mutilated.] MS. Ch. Northants. 233.
Grant from William de Fonte of Staverton to the prior and convent of Daventr', in great part effaced. (c. 1260-70.) MS. Ch. Northants. 252.
Fragment of a charter ... de Weltona quit-claims to Richard de ... in the same village of the monks of the abbey (sic) of St. Augustine of Daventr'. (c. 1230-40.) MS. Ch. Northants. 260.
